page.title: 10 HILL FARM
page.content: HILL FARM 167 acres. A mixed farm, council rented, worked by the farmer, his wife and son. Fields vary in size 27-73 acres. One small meadow grows hay for the animals. These include Friesian bullocks (for beef), Jersey cows, a Charolais bull, large-white/land-race sow and boar. Golden cornet hens and T5 white turkeys. From an incubator Khaki-Campbell ducks are hatched and these lay well. COMMUNICATIONS. There is a Transmitter on the hill erected and used by Mid-Anglia General Practice Accident Service. This is also used by others: Pye Telecommunications and Cambridgeshire County Council. MECHANISATION. Most farms use a combine harvester, a sugar beet harvester, tractors, ploughs, seed- drills and spring-tine harrows.
